\normalsize
{\headingfont \large \textbf{\textcolor{headerorange}{SUMMARY}}}

{`r params$geolevel`} District {`r params$district_number`} is the {`r params$disparity_rank`} most racially disparate {`r params$geolevel`} district in California. It ranks {`r params$outcome_rank`} out of {`r params$total_districts`} {`r params$geolevel`} districts in outcomes such as employment, health insurance, and homeownership. 

{\headingfont \large \textbf{\textcolor{headerorange}{BACKGROUND}}}

RACE COUNTS analyzed 31 indicators such as employment, health insurance, and homeownership, for every State {`r params$geolevel`} District and ranked districts by their outcomes and differences in those outcomes among racial groups.

Data sources for indicators include the California Dept. of Education, the California Dept. of Justice, the California Office of Environmental Health Hazard Assessment, the U.S. Census Bureau's American Community Survey and others. All data are the most recent data published or within one year of publication. See \href{https://www.racecounts.org/explore-the-data/our-methodology/}{\textcolor{blue}{our methodology (https://bit.ly/42YKhrj)}} for more information.

{\headingfont \large \textbf{\textcolor{headerorange}{WHY THIS IS IMPORTANT}}}

Understanding racial disparities in each district is essential to creating fair and effective policy. Data on racial disparity highlight where local systems fail to deliver equitable outcomes and reveal opportunities for targeted policies that close gaps. By examining these disparities, policy makers can work alongside their constituents to promote equity in their districts. 

{\headingfont \large \textbf{\textcolor{headerorange}{WHAT YOU CAN DO ABOUT IT}}}

Addressing racial disparities starts with partnership. Policymakers can engage community organizations that work directly with affected residents to understand their experiences and co-create solutions with them. By supporting data-driven policies, investing in equity initiatives, and amplifying community voices, policymakers can advance systemic change and ensure every community has the opportunity to thrive.  Learn more about \href{https://www.catalystcalifornia.org/how-we-do-it/government-relations}{\textcolor{blue}{Catalyst Californiaâ€™s legislative priorities (https://bit.ly/4hwSoBG)}}.
\end{multicols}
